_exec_summary.SummaryText: It is the policy of Heimerl Farms Ltd., 3891 Mink Rd., Johnstown, OHIO 43031 and its administrators to prevent an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia by maintaining equipment and training employees in proper storage, handling, and use of the material. In the event of an emergency, we would rely on the Johnstown-Monroe Fire Department, Licking County Hazardous Materials Handling Team, and on site administrators to control the situation. The stationary source is comprised of two (2) interconnected storage tanks containing 49,440 pounds each, or 98,880 pounds in combination. The worst case scenario, as designated in the Risk Management Plan would include a total loss of the contents stored in one storage tank. The alternative release scenario, as designated in the Risk Management Plan would include partial losses as a result of a transfer hose failure. This would be the effects of an unintended release of a single nurse tank quantifying 4120 pounds of product. There are no administrative controls which can prevent or limit the distance of the potential material release. Mitigation measures are comprised of excess flow valves which restrict flow of product, and a security system designed to deter theft of the product. The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps are to adhere to the normal operating procedures designed in the use of anhydrous ammonia fertilizer tanks. The five-year accident history is void of any releases from the storage tank facility. The emergency response program in case of an ammonia leak are as follows: 1) evacuate all non-essential personnel to the main office building; 2) notify management and on site Emergency Action Plan Coordinator; 3) determination of leak, if less than 100 pounds and with the use of PPE, stop the flow of gas if feasible; 4) notify local fire department, notify Licking County Hazardous Materials Handling Team, notify Ohio Environmental Protection Agency, notify Ohio Department

of Natural Resources, notify Ohio Department of Agriculture, notify CHEMTREC; notify Risk Management Coordinator. As an organization, we hold annual trainings with farm personnel on proper handling and transport means. All policies and procedures are reviewed and changed if necessary on an annual basis.
